title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> Release fully done! :)  
00:05 <sdumitriu> I see you didn't create a PURL  
00:05 <vmassol> yes  
00:06 <sburjan`> vmassol: testig 4.3 with MySQL using DW  
00:06 <vmassol> I have listed some ways to make the release process simpler and I'll make a proposal tomorrow to speed it up  
00:07 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
00:07 <sburjan`> it seems stuck when --> Importing document [XWikiServerClass] in language []...  
00:07 <vmassol> \*documentation  
00:07 <sburjan`> ah no, just a hidden merge conflicty  
00:08 <jvelo> I agree re PURL  
00:08 <jvelo> it would make more sense if we were using it for emails or OW2 blog post  
00:08 <jvelo> but for twitter, I don't get the value  
00:09 <vmassol> note that I made a mistake too on the OW2 announcement  
00:09 <vmassol> I didn't put the link to the release notes in the releasenotes.<version>.twxt file. I thought it was going to be added automatically by the script but I was wrong  
00:09 <sburjan`> vmassol: yes, the user is right, I am able to reproduce his issue.  
00:09 <vmassol> sburjan`: ah too bad  
00:09 <sburjan`> yes :(  
00:09 <vmassol> can you try the workaround I mentioned  
00:10 <vmassol> ?  
00:10 <vmassol> we'll need to put it in the release notes somewhere  
00:10 <vmassol> it means the XEM tests don't even test the home page :)  
00:10 <jvelo> yay, looks like the lucene 4.0.0 upgrade is functional :)  
00:10 <vmassol> cool!!  
00:11 <jvelo> I'll work on solr next, with Edy if he can help me  
00:11 <vmassol> that's great news jvelo  
00:11 <sburjan`> vmassol: XemResource.Translations is already in the list  
00:11 <vmassol> hmm  
00:11 <vmassol> can you check its content?  
00:11 <jvelo> vmassol: no I need to cast a vote because it's breaking a couple of APIs  
00:11 <jvelo> s/no/now/  
00:12 <sburjan`> vmassolyes, it seems it has the transaltions keys  
00:12 <jvelo> due to the fact we are exposing lucene classes in our method signatures in the module  
00:12 <vmassol> sburjan`: we'll need to check with thomas tomorrow  
00:12 <jvelo> and those have changed  
00:12 <sburjan`> vmassol: yes, it seems it has the translations key. But I don't see the button to "complete" Workspaces instalation  
00:12 <sburjan`> wait  
00:12 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:13 <vmassol> it's bed time here….  
00:13 <sburjan`> here too :)  
00:13 <vmassol> got to go, tty tomorrow  
00:13 <jvelo> bye  
00:13 <vmassol> nn  
00:13 <vmassol> has quit  
00:16 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:21 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:27 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:02 <vmassol> has quit  
01:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:52 <vmassol> has quit  
01:58 <mrvanes> has quit  
02:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:43 <jvelo> has quit  
03:01 <vmassol> has quit  
03:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
03:43 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
04:07 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:09 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:34 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <sburjan`> vmassol: seems you forgot to release 4.3 on jira  
08:27 <vmassol> sburjan`: indeed, I did it but wrongly  
08:27 <vmassol> thanks, fixing  
08:28 <sburjan`> I need it to report the XEM blocker :(  
08:28 <vmassol> one  
08:28 <vmassol> done  
08:28 <sburjan`> thank you  
08:32 <sburjan`> reported. this looks like something bag wants to go into the database  
08:33 <sburjan`> Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect string value: '\xE6\xB8\xAC\xE8\xA9\xA6...' for column 'XWD\_CONTENT' at row 1  
08:33 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <zykes-> cjd: ?  
08:56 <vmassol> guys, should we remove the 4.4M1 from issues that appear in this query and that are also fixed in 4.3? (I think so):  
08:56 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+AND+fixVersion+in+%28%224.4-milestone-1%22%2C+%224.4-rc-1%22%2C+%224.4%22%29+AND+resolution+in+%28Fixed%29+AND+assignee+%3D+enygma  
08:56 <vmassol> gtg, bb in 1 hour  
08:57 <mrvanes> has quit  
08:58 <cjd> zykes-: ?  
08:58 <zykes-> did you get to look at the bug I raised ?  
09:00 <cjd> no  
09:25 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <zykes-> is the realtime edit stuff in yet ?  
09:36 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <cjd> it's available as an extension  
09:58 <Denis> vmassol: I propose to remove "Updating database schema:" and to keep "[schema] - Checking Hibernate mapping and updating schema if needed". Is that ok for you ? (third attempt !)  
10:04 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <autoditac> has quit  
10:19 <zykes-> cjd: would you have a chance to look at my issue ?  
10:19 <zykes-> I can't install any extension atm without enabling tomcat to listen to 8080 on 0.0.0.0 again ...  
10:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <cjd> I've got a lot of stuff to do right at the moment  
10:26 <zykes-> ok.. gues i'll have to enable tomcat ot listen then ..  
10:27 <cjd> it's also very likely that it will turn out to be a bug in the javascript library or even the browser  
10:27 <zykes-> cjd: in 2 diff browsers ?  
10:27 <cjd> ok then not the browser  
10:27 <zykes-> let me try  
10:28 <cjd> it's a relitive XMLHttpRequest so it's doing the right thing at our end  
10:29 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <zykes-> same error on ie, ff and chrome cjd  
10:29 <zykes-> kinda annoying :(  
10:31 <vmassol> Denis: yes ok, the less unnecessary info the better :)  
10:31 <cjd> yeap, I learned a while back that when you start mixing and matching software, you have to be ready to dig through issues and submit patches ;)  
10:31 <zykes-> since everything is else working superbly :p  
10:31 <vmassol> Denis: not sure we need [schema] though as a prefix since we don't use that in the other logs  
10:31 <zykes-> cjd: well isn't it a common pattern to utilize a frontend proxy to tomcat ?  
10:33 <cjd> common practice is to use an apache2 --> tomcat connector, I can't remember what it's called right now..  
10:34 <cjd> AJP  
10:34 <zykes-> cjd: is there a wiki thing for that? Couldn't find it  
10:35 <sburjan> tmortagne: replied  
10:36 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
10:39 <vmassol> ok jira cleanup for 4.4M1 done  
10:39 <vmassol> I couldn't understand how we were starting with more than 35 issues fixed for 4.4M1  
10:39 <vmassol> they were issues fixed in 4.3  
10:39 <vmassol> so it's not normal to see them as done in the release notes for 4.4M1  
10:40 <tmortagne> sburjan: could you indicate your MySQL server and connector version since I guess it might be helpful  
10:40 <tmortagne> looks like a bug  
10:40 <vmassol> fyi: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11291  
10:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: we always did like this, we put the version correcponding to the branch were we coommit  
10:40 <vmassol> it's bad  
10:40 <vmassol> we already discussed it  
10:41 <sburjan> tmortagne: trying to reproduce now on the test machine and then I will update the config  
10:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes we did and we agreed on it...  
10:41 <vmassol> it' s ok for bug fix releases  
10:41 <vmassol> there's absolutely no logic in seeing 38 issues fixed in 4.4M1  
10:41 <zykes-> have you guys concidered using gerrit and integrating it with gerrit etc ?  
10:41 <vmassol> so either we have to exclude all 4.3 from the query for 4.4  
10:42 <vmassol> or we need to not put 4.4M1 when we know we're going to release 4.3 or we fix them afterwards as I've done  
10:43 <vmassol> it might have been simpler for me to just exclude 4.3 from teh query though, will think about it for next time  
10:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: to be clear I'm not so much against put both 4.4M1 and 4.3 in the issue (I understand why we do this and I do it too).But I'm more against making those issues visible in the RN for 4.4 as if they were work done during 4.4, i.e. they are counted twice  
10:45 <sburjan> tmortagne: can't figure out. The error is in workspacetemplate database or in xwiki database ?  
10:45 <vmassol> right now http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11291 cleanly reflects the work done for 4.4  
10:45 <zykes-> cjd: so what can I do to debug further ?  
10:46 <tmortagne> sburjan: not sure what this has to do with the server/connector version  
10:46 <tmortagne> you have the connector version on the jar file name  
10:47 <tmortagne> and for mysql it depends of your system, on linux you can type "mysql --version"  
10:48 <tmortagne> as for when the error happen, according to the stack trace it seems to be during template creation  
10:50 <tmortagne> so either:  
10:50 <tmortagne> \* there is a bug in the connector  
10:52 <sburjan> vmassol: this message is slightly confusing, more confusing than on XE http://pastebin.com/e29sanV1  
10:53 <vmassol> that's XE sburjan  
10:53 <vmassol> :)  
10:53 <vmassol> you should talk to Denis about it....  
10:53 <sburjan> I got this on XEM :P  
10:53 <vmassol> yes but it comes from XE code  
10:53 <vmassol> you have the same thing on XE  
10:54 <tmortagne> sburjan: could you check the encoding used in the template database ?  
10:55 <Denis> vmassol: [schema] will prefix the 3 step of 2) as we talk yesterday, but I may remove it, if you thing its better  
10:56 <sburjan> tmortagne: now I'm installing XEM (DW) on the database machine  
10:56 <tmortagne> sburjan: ok, when you reproduce XWIKI-8513 try to check what is the encoding of the database created for the template  
10:57 <tmortagne> see if it's the database creation that has been broken  
10:57 <tmortagne> since the same document is supposed to have been imported on the main wiki too and without any error if there is all your log  
10:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: could you tell me how to check the encoding please ? :)  
10:57 <sburjan> I know, n00b question  
10:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: "SHOW CREATE DATABASE dbname;" I think  
10:59 <autoditac> has quit  
10:59 <tmortagne> in any case it will show how the database has been created which is what we want to know here  
11:00 <tmortagne> (did XWiki forced the proper charset)  
11:00 <tmortagne> (replace dbname with the name of the template database of course)  
11:07 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <sburjan> tmortagne: updated  
11:20 <autoditac> has quit  
11:33 <vmassol> msmeria: please don't use extra new lines, for ex at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Notifications?viewer=changes&rev1=24.1&rev2=25.1  
11:33 <vmassol> (lines 9 and 10)  
11:34 <vmassol> msmeria: also use ((( … ))) when putting an image related to a list item  
11:34 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Notifications?viewer=changes&rev1=24.1&rev2=25.1  
11:34 <vmassol> you should write:  
11:34 <vmassol> \* Watch this page: you follow modifications affecting the page you are currently viewing(((  
11:34 <vmassol> {{image reference="WatchPage.png"/}}  
11:34 <vmassol> )))  
11:34 <vmassol> this will make the image part of the list item  
11:35 <vmassol> right now they are badly aligned  
11:35 <vmassol> msmeria: I don't quite agree about describing the wtachlist application on the notifications page in details  
11:35 <msmeria> thanks. i'm updating the documents now  
11:35 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <vmassol> it's better to point to the wtachist app and have that documentation there  
11:36 <vmassol> one image is fine  
11:36 <vmassol> but not 4-5  
11:36 <vmassol> I believe we need to talk with silviar  
11:36 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <msmeria> vmassol: thanks. i'm gonna ask silvia what to do  
11:38 <vmassol> msmeria: yep I've pinged her to explain things, we can do a talk the 3 of us  
11:38 <vmassol> and I can explain the rules that I've followed so far  
11:39 <vmassol> sburjan could join us if he wants  
11:39 <sburjan> vmassol: I already did :)  
11:42 <zykes-> Hmm  
11:42 <zykes-> how could I use a different storage engine then local disk or so for storing images etc?  
11:43 <zykes-> say openstack swift  
11:47 <vmassol> zykes-: check doc on xwiki.org  
11:47 <vmassol> especially admin guide  
12:06 <zykes-> Where are the installed extensions installed so I can back them up ?  
12:10 <autoditac> has quit  
12:17 <zykes-> hmmm, if I haven't set the environment.permanentDirectory where are the things stored then ?  
12:17 <tmortagne> zykes-: where your permanent directory is  
12:17 <tmortagne> look at the beginning of your log  
12:17 <tmortagne> you should have a warning  
12:17 <zykes-> ah  
12:17 <tmortagne> saying that environment.permanentDirectory and Xwiki will fallback on ...  
12:18 <zykes-> /var/cache/tomcat7/Catalina/localhost/xwiki :)  
12:18 <zykes-> I'm used to python / php / ruby apps :p  
12:18 <tmortagne> that's the standard tomcat temporary directory  
12:18 <tmortagne> basically for backup you have that folder and the database  
12:19 <zykes-> but I can't see it storing attachments there ?  
12:20 <tmortagne> zykes-: you will get attachements there only if you setup FS attachement storage  
12:20 <tmortagne> by default attachemens are in the database  
12:21 <zykes-> ah  
12:21 <sburjan> anyone has any idea how can I see the memory settings of a default TOmcat instalation ? XmX, etc  
12:21 <tmortagne> you also get the lucene index in there but it's less criticall since it can be recreated anytime  
12:21 <tmortagne> sburjan: looks at what you have in the "ps aux"  
12:22 <zykes-> hmmm, I wanna use swift I can to store stuff  
12:22 <zykes-> lots faster then serving from xwiki  
12:22 <sburjan> tmortagne:  
12:22 <sburjan> iki/Desktop/apache-tomcat-7.0.32 -Djava.io.tmpdir=/home/xwiki/Desktop/apache-tomcat-7.0.32/temp org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap start  
12:22 <sburjan> I don't see any  
12:23 <tmortagne> so I guess it's the default  
12:23 <tmortagne> I think admin tool app have a tool for this  
12:23 <tmortagne> or its another extension on extensions.xwiki.org  
12:23 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Admin+Tools+Application  
12:23 <tmortagne> the CheckConfig page I would say  
12:23 <autoditac> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <vmassol> zykes-: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
12:30 <tmortagne> sburjan: are you working with 4.3 ?  
12:31 <sburjan> tmortagne: no, I was asking about tomcat memory for another stuff.  
12:31 <sburjan> but regarding the blocker, my ideas ran out before yours :)  
12:31 <tmortagne> sburjan: was not talking about tomcat, but I mean the other test you did  
12:32 <sburjan> no, not working on that  
12:32 <tmortagne> sburjan: I have a weird issue on XE on 4.3 and was wondering if you were able to reproduce it  
12:32 <sburjan> tell me. I'lltry to reproduce  
12:33 <tmortagne> I get jetty/hsqldb distribution  
12:33 <sburjan> downloading it now  
12:33 <evalica> vmassol: Just for the record. see Commits tab for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-233 - doesn't work, it doesn't list the commit  
12:34 <tmortagne> delete the database and set all the extension as not installed by hand in the data/extension/  
12:34 <tmortagne> the idea is to get a demo of the DW fully working without any internet access basically  
12:34 <vmassol> evalica: I'll check, do you have the link to the commit?  
12:35 <tmortagne> but it should not change anything from jetty/mysql distribution were extensions are downloaded from the issue I have  
12:35 <evalica> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e49d04a7502af6efa6cdf44dffebf8ab36c1a571 and https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/be81774a1342ada8029ec04e98c7bb4223f843c1  
12:35 <vmassol> this is platform evalica  
12:35 <vmassol> not XEM  
12:35 <vmassol> your issue is XEM  
12:35 <vmassol> the issue is bad  
12:36 <sburjan> tmortagne: so I remove completely the database dir before or after having the wiki started for the first time ?  
12:36 <vmassol> it needs to be moved to the XWIKI project  
12:36 <tmortagne> sburjan: you don't start anything  
12:36 <tmortagne> you prepare it before  
12:36 <vmassol> Enygma` should have moved the issue  
12:36 <evalica> vmassol: k - I'll move it  
12:36 <evalica> :) next time … I'll find another :P  
12:36 <vmassol> it just works  
12:36 <vmassol> :)  
12:36 <evalica> k  
12:37 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's to have the exact same use case as me but given the issue I don't think it's really related  
12:37 <sburjan> unpacking package now  
12:37 <tmortagne> but I find it weird that we did not seen it before the release so I want someone else to reproduce the exact same use case first  
12:37 <tmortagne> here is the issue: so as expected, when starting it I get the DW, I install the UI but when the installed is done I don't have the continue button  
12:38 <tmortagne> only skip and cancel  
12:38 <tmortagne> like the DW did not seen that the install was done  
12:39 <sburjan> tmortagne: try a refresh page :) you'll see the continue button :)  
12:39 <sburjan> I got this also, without any tricks  
12:39 <tmortagne> sburjan: is this reported ?  
12:40 <tmortagne> it's the first time I see this bug  
12:40 <sburjan> tmortagne: afaik mflorea might know about it. I kinda remember this, but can't remember if I reported it  
12:40 <vmassol> evalica: I need to update the DVCS plugin there's been a lot of updates  
12:41 <vmassol> 7 releases to be precise  
12:41 <vmassol> actually 5  
12:41 <tmortagne> sburjan: I don't remember seeing a jira issue about it, I probably missed it then but it's a pretty important issue  
12:41 <tmortagne> mflorea ?  
12:42 <zykes-> what's common practice to upgrade the wiki, just rm -rf the old webapp dir and extract a new war ?  
12:42 <zykes-> and copy in config  
12:42 <vmassol> starting meeting....  
12:42 <mflorea> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8207  
12:42 <evalica> I've moved the issue, but the commit was done with the old JIRA issue name, so I've manually added a comment with the commits - it would be great if in the updates we could specify multiple repositories  
12:42 <mflorea> sburjan: you should remember the issues you open..  
12:42 <sburjan> mflorea: yes :)  
12:42 <tmortagne> ok then  
12:53 <mflorea> has quit  
12:54 <zykes-> dang, xwiki is nice I must say!  
12:54 <zykes-> you have a really good product!  
12:56 <Enygma`> vmassol: I`ve noticed you`ve removed the 4.4-m1 fix version for some issues. Theoretically, you are right, since if it's fixed for 4.3 final, then it is also fixed for 4.4-m1. However, practically, those are 2 different branches and the commit from master (4.4-m1) is also cherry-picked to 4.3 (4.3.x). If this is to be considered a purely technical aspect, then it also does not make sense for us to specify 4.3.1 together with 4.4-m1 for instance, for the same  
12:57 <zykes-> hmm, I have a error when upgrading, "StepProgressEvent was fired too many times: [2] instead of [1]. The number of times StepProgressEvent is fired must match the number of steps passed to PushLevelProgressEvent." < what does that mean ?  
13:12 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:24 <tmortagne> zykes-: that means there is a bug is whatever task you we executing when generating the progress bar information  
13:24 <tmortagne> if you can reproduce it easily would be nice to report it on jira.xwiki.org  
13:26 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> Enygma`:  
13:38 <vmassol> re your comment above  
13:38 <vmassol> I have discussed it a bit more above too  
13:38 <vmassol> (this morning)  
13:38 <vmassol> it's a difficult topic  
13:39 <vmassol> for my use case I didn't want to see 37 issues done for 4.4M1 when there were done in 4.3  
13:39 <autoditac> has quit  
13:39 <vmassol> and I could have fixed this by explicitly excluding 4.3 from my 4.4 jira filter  
13:39 <vmassol> it's probably the simplest to do  
13:40 <vmassol> if we go this way it means we need to be careful in all our queries to exclude stuff  
13:40 <vmassol> which makes writing correct queries harder  
13:40 <vmassol> the other option is to do what I've done, ie cleanup after the fact  
13:40 <vmassol> the last option is when you know the order of releases, to not mention a fix for for a release that you're sure will happen after  
13:41 <vmassol> it's tricky and TBH I don't know of a good strategy  
13:45 <Enygma`> vmassol: ok, I`ll try to keep in mind these details when filling in fix versions. I guess it would be nice if we had a best practice entry as well :)  
13:45 <vmassol> yeah but we need to come up with one first :)

15:43 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: The problem can be summed up as follows: Dirty flag must be propagated to owning instance of XWikiDocument when changing property values, attachments and class definitions for the version number to be updated.
